segment.source: Review the release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: Review the release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Release notes for the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This section provides release notes for the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: This section provides release notes for the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: These libraries support XAML and JavaScript/HTML apps for Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.
segment.target: These libraries support XAML and JavaScript/HTML apps for Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.

segment.source: Installation
segment.target: Installation

segment.source: The Microsoft advertising libraries are available as part of the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: The Microsoft advertising libraries are available as part of the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: For all project types other than Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight, the Microsoft Advertising assemblies that used to be distributed in the earlier standalone releases of the Microsoft Universal Ad Client SDK and Microsoft Advertising SDK are now installed with the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: For all project types other than Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight, the Microsoft Advertising assemblies that used to be distributed in the earlier standalone releases of the Microsoft Universal Ad Client SDK and Microsoft Advertising SDK are now installed with the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: For more information about installing the SDK and the libraries that are included in it, see Install the Microsoft advertising libraries.
segment.target: For more information about installing the SDK and the libraries that are included in it, see Install the Microsoft advertising libraries.

segment.source: To get the Microsoft advertising assemblies for Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects, install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, open your project in Visual Studio, and then go to ProjectAdd Connected ServiceAd Mediator to automatically download the assemblies.
segment.target: To get the Microsoft advertising assemblies for Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects, install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, open your project in Visual Studio, and then go to ProjectAdd Connected ServiceAd Mediator to automatically download the assemblies.

segment.source: After doing this, you can remove the ad mediator references from your project if you do not want to use ad mediation.
segment.target: After doing this, you can remove the ad mediator references from your project if you do not want to use ad mediation.

segment.source: For more information, see AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight.
segment.target: For more information, see AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight.

segment.source: Understanding the difference between Microsoft advertising libraries and ad mediation
segment.target: Understanding the difference between Microsoft advertising libraries and ad mediation

segment.source: Although both the Microsoft advertising libraries and the ad mediation libraries are provided by the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, these libraries serve different purposes.
segment.target: Although both the Microsoft advertising libraries and the ad mediation libraries are provided by the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, these libraries serve different purposes.

segment.source: Use the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes in the Microsoft advertising libraries if you want to display banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft in a XAML or JavaScript app.
segment.target: Use the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes in the Microsoft advertising libraries if you want to display banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft in a XAML or JavaScript app.

segment.source: Use the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries if you want to display banner ads from multiple ad networks in a XAML app (ad mediation is not supported for JavaScript/HTML apps).
segment.target: Use the AdMediatorControl class in the ad mediation libraries if you want to display banner ads from multiple ad networks in a XAML app (ad mediation is not supported for JavaScript/HTML apps).

segment.source: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.
segment.target: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.

segment.source: Uninstall previous versions
segment.target: Uninstall previous versions

segment.source: Before you install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, it is highly recommended that you uninstall all prior instances of the Microsoft Universal Ad Client SDK or the Microsoft Advertising SDK.
segment.target: Before you install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, it is highly recommended that you uninstall all prior instances of the Microsoft Universal Ad Client SDK or the Microsoft Advertising SDK.

segment.source: Target architecture-specific build outputs
segment.target: Target architecture-specific build outputs

segment.source: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.
segment.target: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.

segment.source: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning in your project after you add a reference to the Microsoft advertising libraries.
segment.target: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning in your project after you add a reference to the Microsoft advertising libraries.

segment.source: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).
segment.target: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).

segment.source: For more information, see Known issues.
segment.target: For more information, see Known issues.

segment.source: C++ Support
segment.target: C++ Support

segment.source: The Microsoft advertising libraries (which include the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes) support apps written in C++ and DirectX using Windows Runtime Interoperability (interop).
segment.target: The Microsoft advertising libraries (which include the AdControl and InterstitialAd classes) support apps written in C++ and DirectX using Windows Runtime Interoperability (interop).

segment.source: For more information and examples about programming using XAML and C++, see Type System.
segment.target: For more information and examples about programming using XAML and C++, see Type System.

segment.source: No toolbox control
segment.target: No toolbox control

segment.source: In the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, there is no toolbox control for dragging an AdControl or InterstitialAd to a design surface in your app.
segment.target: In the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, there is no toolbox control for dragging an AdControl or InterstitialAd to a design surface in your app.

segment.source: For instructions about adding these controls in your markup and code, see the developer walkthroughs.
segment.target: For instructions about adding these controls in your markup and code, see the developer walkthroughs.

segment.source: Latitude and longitude properties no longer available
segment.target: Latitude and longitude properties no longer available

segment.source: The AdControl class no longer has Latitude and Longitude properties for UWP apps.
segment.target: The AdControl class no longer has Latitude and Longitude properties for UWP apps.

segment.source: Instead, code built into the ad control will detect and send these values to the ad servers on the app’s behalf.
segment.target: Instead, code built into the ad control will detect and send these values to the ad servers on the app’s behalf.

segment.source: Important notice
segment.target: Important notice

segment.source: Be sure to read the end user license agreement (EULA) in its entirety.
segment.target: Be sure to read the end user license agreement (EULA) in its entirety.

segment.source: See the topic Important notice - EULA.
segment.target: See the topic Important notice - EULA.
